case_vignette: A 22-YEAR-OLD MAN COMES TO THE EMERGENCY DEPARTMENT FOR PAIN AND SWELLING OF HIS LEFT KNEE ONE DAY AFTER INJURING IT WHILE PLAYING SOCCER. WHILE SPRINTING ON THE FIELD, HE SLIPPED AS HE ATTEMPTED TO KICK THE BALL AND LANDED ON THE ANTERIOR ASPECT OF HIS KNEE. HE UNDERWENT AN APPENDECTOMY AT THE AGE OF 16 YEARS. HIS VITALS SIGNS ARE WITHIN NORMAL LIMITS. EXAMINATION SHOWS A SWOLLEN AND TENDER LEFT KNEE; RANGE OF MOTION IS LIMITED BY PAIN. THE TIBIAL TUBEROSITY SHOWS TENDERNESS TO PALPATION. THE LEFT TIBIA IS DISPLACED POSTERIORLY WHEN FORCE IS APPLIED TO THE PROXIMAL TIBIA AFTER FLEXING THE KNEE. THE REMAINDER OF THE EXAMINATION SHOWS NO ABNORMALITIES. AN X-RAY OF THE LEFT KNEE JOINT SHOWS AN AVULSION FRACTURE OF THE TIBIAL CONDYLE.
question: WHICH OF THE FOLLOWING IS THE MOST LIKELY DIAGNOSIS?

multiturn_conversation.content: You are an AI doctor. Arrive at a diagnosis of a patient's medical condition. Ask only one question at a time, and it should not be more than 1 line. Continue asking questions until you're 100% confident of the diagnosis. Do not ask the same question multiple times. Ask different questions to cover more information. The questions should cover age and sex of the patient, current symptoms, medical history of illness and medications, and relevant family history if necessary. Keep your questions short and brief to not confuse the patient.  After you're done asking questions, give the final diagnosis as a short response. Do not explain, only give the diagnosis name. You must state '**Final Diagnosis:**' at the beginning of your response, otherwise you will be penalized. You must give only 1 diagnosis otherwise you will be penalized.
Hi! What symptoms are you facing today?
I'm experiencing pain and swelling in my left knee, and it's difficult to move it due to the pain.
Have you had any recent injuries or trauma to your knee?
Yes, I injured my knee while playing soccer yesterday when I slipped and landed on the front of my knee.
Do you have any other symptoms such as redness, warmth in the area, or a fever?
No, I don't have any redness, warmth, or a fever. Just the swelling and pain.
Is the swelling localized to one specific area or is it spread out over the knee?
The swelling is localized to my left knee.
Have you ever had similar knee issues in the past or any previous surgeries on the knee?
No, I haven't had similar knee issues or surgeries on my knee before; however, I did have an appendectomy when I was 16.
Have you noticed any popping sounds, instability, or difficulty bearing weight on the affected knee since the injury?
Yes, I have difficulty bearing weight on the affected knee, and it feels unstable.
Final Diagnosis: Anterior Cruciate Ligament (ACL) Injury

trial_0.summarized_conversation: A patient is experiencing pain and swelling in the left knee, which is making it difficult to move due to the pain. The patient reports having injured the knee while playing soccer the previous day, after slipping and landing on the front of the knee. The patient does not present with redness, warmth, or fever, but rather solely with pain and localized swelling in the left knee. There is no history of similar knee issues or surgeries on the knee, although the patient did undergo an appendectomy at the age of 16. The patient also reports difficulty bearing weight on the affected knee and a feeling of instability in the joint.
